availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Trabue, Sr. (Barren County, Ky, shaver and retired merchant)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, shaver. Woodford County, Kentucky, native. Son of Edward Trabue and Martha Trabue. Married to Elizabeth Trabue. Father of Elizabeth Trabue, George Washington Trabue Jr., and Mary T. Trabue. Resident in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Barren County in 1850. Shaver in Barren County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Third Manuscript Census of the United States (1810), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, p. 397.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 1, p. 396A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, Division 1, p. 190.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, p. 1062.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Glasgow, District 2, p. 73A
Find A Grave, "George Washington Trabue, Sr. (1793-1873)," Memorial #112400992, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112400992 (accessed January 2019).
